intro: Thorncroftia lotteri, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a deciduous shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain seeds covered in a fibrous coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
